thig13.2:11.3_0: they understand the end of suffering—
thig13.2:12.2_0: they don’t look back with longing,
thig13.2:12.3_0: They go to the wrong place,
thig13.2:13.1_0: They hoard no goods in storerooms,
thig13.2:13.3_0: They seek food prepared by others—
thig13.2:14.2_0: or gold whether coined or uncoined;
thig13.2:14.3_0: feeding on whatever comes that day,
thig13.2:15.1_0: They have gone forth from different families,
thig13.2:15.3_0: and yet they all love one another—
thig13.2:16.1_0: “Dear Rohinī, it was truly for our benefit
thig13.2:16.2_0: that you were born in our family!
thig13.2:16.3_0: You have faith and such keen respect
thig13.2:16.4_0: for the Buddha, his teaching, and the Sangha.
thig13.2:18.1_0: For there we will place our sacrifice,
thig13.2:19.1_0: Go for refuge to the Buddha,
thig13.2:19.3_0: Ethics are the word of ethical conduct,
thig13.2:21.1_0: I used to belong to the brahmin caste,
thig13.2:21.2_0: now I genuinely am a brahmin.
thig13.2:21.3_0: Possessing the three knowledges, I’m a genuine scholar,
thig13.2:21.4_0: I’m a knowledge-master, a bathed initiate.”
thig13.2:3.1_0: They don’t like to work, they’re lazy,
thig13.2:3.3_0: always on the lookout, greedy for sweets—
thig13.2:3.4_0: so why do you like ascetics?”
thig13.2:5.1_0: They like to work, they’re not lazy;
thig13.2:5.2_0: by giving up greed and hate,
thig13.2:5.3_0: they do the best kind of work—
thig13.2:6.1_0: As for the three roots of evil,
thig13.2:6.2_0: by pure deeds they shake them off.
thig13.2:6.3_0: They have given up all wickedness—
thig13.2:7.3_0: their actions of mind are pure—
thig13.2:9.3_0: teaching the text and its meaning:
